definition: needless to say/it goes without saying
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)

sentences.english: Needless to say, he had a stomach fire in Fu Youli.
sentences.chinese: 不用說，他這一肚子的火又發在了傅由理身上。

sentences.english: Needless to say, the British made no attempt to introduce anti-racist legislation.
sentences.chinese: 不用說，英國人是懶得在香港對反種族主義立法的。

sentences.english: The result, needless to say, is mind-spinning.
But fishing appears to be the main and favorite activity.
sentences.chinese: 但不用說釣魚是最讓人喜愛的主要活動。

sentences.english: Bananas are scarce, not to mention mangos.
sentences.chinese: 香蕉已下市了，更不用說芒果了。

sentences.english: Plus you must sometimes deal with the stressful intricacies of bargaining.
sentences.chinese: 更不用說有時你還要面對艱難的議價。

sentences.english: Needless to say, working and attending school full-time proved to be quite an undertaking.
sentences.chinese: 不用說，同時工作和學習是一項多麼龐大的工程。

sentences.english: 'It goes without saying such a target would be difficult to reach, ' Mr. Ito said Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 伊東孝紳週二說，不用說，這一目標將難以實現。

sentences.english: Finding evidence of that sort of skulduggery may be difficult, and proving it even more so.
sentences.chinese: 想找到這種類型的作假十分困難，更不用說找出證據。

sentences.english: Discretion, it goes without saying, is the cornerstone of long-term success in the amatory arts.
sentences.chinese: 慎重，不用說，這是在愛情藝術中長期的基礎。

sentences.english: Needless to say, the marcus hope this documentary can sell a good price.
sentences.chinese: 不用說，馬卡斯希望這部記錄片能賣個好價錢。

sentences.english: Only seeing the mountains in Jinan had me surprised and pleased, let alone the others.
sentences.chinese: 不用說別的，單說見到濟南的山，就讓我又驚又喜。

sentences.english: Even a small factory can do the job, not to mention such a big factory as ours.
sentences.chinese: 這樣的活連小廠都能做，更不用說我們這樣的大廠了。

sentences.english: The people in that village have not seen electric lights, let alone TV sets.
sentences.chinese: 那個村子裏的人連電燈都沒見過，更不用說電視了。

sentences.english: The baby can't even sit up yet, let alone walk!
sentences.chinese: 這個嬰兒連坐都坐不穩，更不用說走路了。

sentences.english: It goes without saying that children should not play with gun.
sentences.chinese: 不用說孩子是不能玩槍的。

definition: only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
only natural/as it should be/certainly/of course/without doubt
let alone/to say nothing of/besides/what's more
after all/all in all/when all is said and done/in the final analysis
to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])
